description.value: A set of ordered Physical Quantities, that indicates that the value comes from a range of possible values. In general, a range may be expressed in different ways: using a low and high value (e.g. from 3 mg to 5 mg); using a centre and a width (4 mg ± 1 mg); and so on. This standard imposes restrictions on the possible options allowed by the ISO 21090 data type, but derived models can further constrain the range representation.

human.value: A range SHALL be represented specifying the low and high limits of the range (e.g. from 2 ml to 4 ml); No other options are allowed.
The units of the low or high limits SHALL match.
It is allowed to omit or value with exceptional values the low and the high limits. (e.g. to indicate < 5 mg)
